sen.j: 米百俵（こめひゃっぴょう）は、幕末から明治初期にかけて活躍した越後長岡藩の藩士小林虎三郎による教育にまつわる故事。
sen.e: Komehyappyo (a hundred straw rice bags) is a historical episode regarding the education by Torasaburo KOBAYASHI (the vassal of Nagaoka Domain Echigo Province), who was active from the end of Edo period through until the early Meiji period.

sen.e: Later, it became famous for the play performed by Yuzo YAMAMOTO.

sen.j: この逸話は、現在の辛抱が将来の利益となることを象徴する物語としてしばしば引用される。
sen.e: This episode is often quoted as a story which tells that present pains lead to future benefits.

sen.j: 実収にして6割を失って財政が窮乏し、藩士たちはその日の食にも苦慮する状態であった。
sen.e: Since Nagaoka domain lost 60% of real income, they were in financial difficulties, and the statesmen of Nagaoka domain were struggling to even find something to eat for a day.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: このため窮状を見かねた長岡藩の支藩越後長岡藩三根山藩から百俵の米が贈られることとなった。
sen.e: The branch domains of Nagaoka domain; the Echigo Nagaoka Domain and Mineyama domain, were compassionate and intended to give a hundred straw rice bags to them.
The branch domains of Nagaoka domain; the Echigo Nagaoka Domain and Mineyama domain, were compassionate and they decided to give a hundred straw rice bags to them.
sen.cmt: "intended to give"の部分を改めました。

sen.j: 藩士たちは、これで生活が少しでも楽になると喜んだ。
sen.e: The statesmen of Nagaoka domain became happy, expecting that their life will be easier.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The retainers of Nagaoka domain became happy, expecting that their life would be easier.

sen.e: The retainers of Nagaoka domain became happy, expecting that their life would be easier.

sen.j: だが、藩の大参事小林虎三郎は、贈られた米を藩士に分け与えず、売却の上で学校設立の費用（学校設備の費用とも）とすることを決定する。
sen.e: However, Daisanji (second to a governor) of Nagaoka domain, Torasaburo KOBAYASHI decided to sell the given rice and found a school (it is also said for school facilities) with the money he sold the rice instead of sharing out them to the statesmen.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 藩士たちはこの通達に驚き反発して虎三郎のもとへと押しかけ抗議した。
sen.e: The statesmen of Nagaoka domain were amazed to have heard his notification, and rushed to Torasaburo's place and protested.
sen.cmt: 後二文と結合し再分割し訳出しました。

sen.j: それに対し虎三郎は、「百俵の米も、食えばたちまちなくなるが、教育にあてれば明日の一万、百万俵となる」と諭し、自らの政策を押しきった。
sen.e: In response, Torasaburo persuaded them and carried through with his policy saying `a hundred straw rice bags will be gone after eating them up, but if they are used for education, they will turn into ten thousand or million rice bags.'

sen.e: The school opened with the money gained from a hundred straw rice bags was `国漢学校.'

sen.e: Although this school was founded by warrior class, children of the common people, who reached the certain academic ability, were allowed to enter the school.

sen.e: 国漢学校 became the predecessor of present Sakanoue Elementary School, Nagaoka City and Nagaoka High School, Niigata Prefecture.
